intro: Stachytarpheta reticulata var. bahiensis, commonly known as Brazilian blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with slender, hairy stems and opposite leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
